description: Construction of a single storey side and rear extension (following demolition of a single storey side and rear extension); replacement of ramp to side elevation; infilling of side elevation window at first floor level with brickwork; and refurbishment works to replace rafters, rendered external surfaces and  windows and door on rear elevation, associated with the change of use from offices (Use Class B1a) to a nursery (Use Class D1) at ground floor level and offices (Use Class B1a) at the upper floor levels (Regulation 3 - Council's Own Development) (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 200-01P, 200-02P, 200-03P, 200-04P, 200-05P, 200-06P, 200-07P, 200-08P, 200-09P received 04/03/2016.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning, and to ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); Ealing Adopted Development Management DPD (2013) Policies 7.4 and 7B; Interim guidance on Residential Extensions; London Plan (2015) Policies 7.4 and 7.6; and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012).

| Details in respect of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council as local planning before the relevant work is begun, to include large scale drawings and samples of materials, as appropriate. The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such approved details:
a. Details and samples of the proposed junctions between the historic building and the proposed new lobby extension;
b. Sample of brick to be used to construct new lobby
c. Details of the proposed new ramp to the new entrance door, including ground levels, and samples of materials;
d. Details of new M&E equipment, including new boiler arrangement, should be submitted.
e. Full details of lighting design should be submitted before installation.  For clarification, no recessed ceiling LEDs are acceptable in the original house.

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building Policy 7C of the Development Management Development Document (2013), Section 12 of the NPPF, and Policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2015).
